Question: If your car was first registered before 1 January 2000, you must renew its warrant of fitness every:
Can you stop on a bus stop in a private motor vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Only if it is for less than 5 minutes

Question: What does a white diamond painted on the road mean?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When must you pull over and allow an ambulance or fire engine to pass?

Answers.Answer: When it is operating its siren or flashing lights
When it is turning right and you have the right of way

Question: You must NOT park on the right-hand side of the road, except when:

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
You must not go unless it is safe
Give way to all other vehicles, except those that have stopped at a stop sign

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?
What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: What is the purpose of the 2-second rule?

Answers.Answer: To provide a safe following distance between vehicles traveling at the same speed
To ensure that vehicles have sufficient stopping time when approaching intersections
To avoid gridlocks in congested driving areas
To ensure the speed limit is observed

Question: When traffic is merging, what is a good rule to follow?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to make room behind
Let one vehicle in and then go
Let two vehicles in and then go

Question: What is the meaning of a yellow broken line painted on the road near the kerb?

Answers.Answer: You may stop for no more than 5 minutes

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is the speed limit for vehicles passing a school bus that has stopped to let children on or off?

Answers.Answer: The lane that has the least vehicles
The lane that gives you the most direct route

Question: What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Drive on but give way to all oncoming vehicles
Stop and wait for a green arrow
Drive on straight ahead only if it is safe
Drive on because all oncoming vehicles are stopped

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: A rest area is 70 metres ahead
Do not stop for the next 70 metres

Question: What is the maximum speed you may drive if you have a ‘space saver wheel’ fitted?
In addition to checking it is safe to move out from the kerb into the traffic flow, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Accelerate quickly into the traffic flow
Move slowly into a space in the traffic flow

Question: What must you do when turning right at a roundabout?

Answers.Answer: Not indicate at any time on the roundabout
Indicate left before entering the roundabout
Indicate right before entering the roundabout
Indicate right when leaving the roundabout

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is the recommended distance you should allow when driving past a cyclist?
If you have to drive at a slow speed which may hold up other vehicles, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep as close as you can to the centre of the road
Keep as close as you can to the left side of the road
Make the traffic behind you slow down to the speed that you are driving at
Drive down the middle of the road so that any vehicles behind you can pass on the left

Question: What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: What does it mean if yellow traffic signals are flashing?

Answers.Answer: That a crash has just happened
The traffic signals are not working, apply the give way rules
Vehicles may only proceed straight ahead and not turn
Emergency vehicles are about to come through

Question: Flush medians can be used when:

Answers.Answer: Keep driving as the cyclist has to stop
Stop and give way to the cyclist

Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist

Question: When you have a learner licence you do not have to have it with you when you drive if your supervisor has their licence with them.
